alert.note: Alert for East Slopes of the Oregon Cascades (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 09 at 10:34PM PST until January 14 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST WEDNESDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions. Additional snow accumulations of 10 to 23 inches. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 12 to 40 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 65 mph. * WHERE...East Slopes of the Oregon Cascades. * WHEN...For the Blizzard Warning, until 4 PM PST Wednesday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from late Wednesday night through Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Strong winds could cause tree damage.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions can be obtained for Oregon by calling 5 1 1 or by visiting online at https://tripcheck.com, or for Washington by visiting online at https://wsdot.com/travel.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes of the Oregon Cascades
